newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP shares up 5.0 pct ahead of Q2 results.
newsitem.headline: SAP shares up 5.0 pct ahead of Q2 results.

text.p: German software group SAP AG on Wednesday surged five percent to over 429 marks at 100 GMT, boosted by rising expectations for second quarter results due on July 24.
In floor trading the stock gained 20 marks from its Tuesday close of 409.80, on increasing interest from investors in the United States, one trader said.
U.S. technology shares have rallied in the last two weeks as PC sector bellwethers Compaq Computer Corp. and Intel Corp. exceeded expectations and eased fears of a computer industry slowdown.
SAP's rise came as Germany's DAX index climbed 1.73 percent to 4,192.34 in Wednesday morning trading.
SAP shares, up 41 percent since June 1, have gained on the group's forecast that second-quarter profit growth would match the 54 percent rise reported in the first three months of 1997.
In June SAP also announced new global contracts with car makers Daimler-Benz AG and Volkswagen AG.
